    • Method Detail

      • findUser

        public User findUser(java.lang.String name)
        Name: findUser
        This method find a user. This method is to avoid that a user will be created twice.
        Pre: The users array must be initialized. users!=null
        Post:
        The user was or wasn't found successfully.
        Parameters:
        name - String. Name of the user. name!="".
        Returns:
        objUser User. If the method find the user, it will return it because you can't create the same user twice.
        But, if the method doesn't find the user, it wouldn't return anything, it would be null and you can create the user.

      • findSong

        public Song findSong(java.lang.String name,
                     java.lang.String singer)
        Name: findSong
        This method find a song. This method is to avoid that a song will be created twice.
        Pre: The pool array must be initialized. pool!=null
        Post:
        The song was or wasn't found successfully.
        Parameters:
        name - String. Name of the song. name!="".
        singer - String. Name of the singer or the band. singer!="".
        Returns:
        objSong Song. If the method find the song, it will return it because you can't create the same song twice.
        But, if the method doesn't find the song, it wouldn't return anything, it would be null and you can create the song.

      • findPlaylist

        public Playlist findPlaylist(java.lang.String name)
        Name: findPlaylist
        This method find a playlist. This method is to avoid that a playlist will be created twice.
        Pre: The playlists array must be initialized. playlists!=null
        Post:
        The playlist was or wasn't found successfully.
        Parameters:
        name - String. Name of the playlist. name!="".
        Returns:
        objPlaylist Playlist. If the method find the playlist, it will return it because you can't create the same playlist twice.
        But, if the method doesn't find the playlist, it wouldn't return anything, it would be null and you can create the playlist.

      • createUser

        public java.lang.String createUser(java.lang.String name,
                                   java.lang.String password,
                                   int age)
        Name: createUser
        This method allow to create an user with all his/her information and save in the users array.
        Pre: The users array must be created.
        Post: The user was created successfully.
        Parameters:
        name - String. Name of the user. name!="".
        password - String. Password of the user. password!="".
        age - int. Age of the user. age!=0.
        Returns:
        message String. Message that confirm or deny if the user was created.

      • createSong

        public java.lang.String createSong(java.lang.String name,
                                   java.lang.String title,
                                   java.lang.String singer,
                                   java.lang.String date,
                                   int time,
                                   int genre)
        Name: createSong
        This method allow to create a song with all its information and save it in the pool array.
        Pre: The pool array must be created.
        Post: The song was created successfully.
        Parameters:
        name - String. Name of the user who added the song. name!="".
        title - String. Name of the song. title!="".
        singer - String. Name of the singer or the band. singer!="".
        date - String. The release date of the song. date!="".
        time - int. Duration of the song in seconds. time!=0.
        genre - int. Option of the genre of the song. genre mayor o igual a 1 Y genre menor o igual a 7
        Returns:
        message String. Message that confirm or deny if the song was created.

      • updateCategory

        public void updateCategory(java.lang.String name)
        Name: updateCategory
        This method upload the category of the user while the user adds songs to the pool array.
        Pre: The user must be create. user!=null.
        Post: The category of the user has been uploaded.
        Parameters:
        name - String. Name of the user who is adding songs to the pool array. name!="".

      • createPlaylist

        public java.lang.String createPlaylist(java.lang.String name,
                                       java.lang.String user)
        Name: createPlaylist
        This method allow to create a private playlist.
        Pre: The playlists array must be created.
        Post: The private playlist has been created.
        Parameters:
        name - String. Name of the private playlist. name!="".
        user - String. Name of the user who created the private playlist. user!="".
        Returns:
        message String. Message that confirm or deny if the private playlist was created.

      • createPlaylist

        public java.lang.String createPlaylist(java.lang.String name)
        Name: createPlaylist
        This method allow to create a public playlist.
        Pre: The playlists array must be created.
        Post: The public playlist has been created.
        Parameters:
        name - String. Name of the public playlist. name!="".
        Returns:
        message String. Message that confirm or deny if the public playlist was created.

      • createPlaylist

        public java.lang.String createPlaylist(java.lang.String name,
                                       int amount,
                                       java.lang.String[] owners)
        Name: createPlaylist
        This method allow to create a restricted playlist.
        Pre: The playlists array must be created.
        Post: The restricted playlist has been created.
        Parameters:
        name - String. Name of the restricted playlist. name!="".
        amount - int. Amount of users with access to the restricted playlist. amount!=0.
        owners - String[]. Name of the owners who can access to the restricted playlist. owners!=null.
        Returns:
        message String. Message that confirm or deny if the restricted playlist was created.

      • gradePlaylist

        public void gradePlaylist(java.lang.String playlistName,
                          int grade)
        Name: gradePlaylist
        This method allow to grade a public playlist.
        Pre: The public playlist must be created.
        Post: The public playlist has been graded.
        Parameters:
        playlistName - String. Name of the playlist. playlistName!="".
        grade - int. Qualification. grade!=0.

      • addSong

        public java.lang.String addSong(java.lang.String playlist,
                                java.lang.String userName,
                                java.lang.String song,
                                java.lang.String singer)
        Name: addSong
        This method allow to add songs to a playlist without care if is a public, private or restricted playlist.
        Pre: The playlist must be created.
        Post: The song has been added to a playlist.
        Parameters:
        playlist - String. Name of the playlist where the user wants to add the song. playlist!="".
        userName - String. Name of the user who is going to add the song. userName!="".
        song - String. Name of the song which it's going to be added to a playlist. song!="".
        singer - String. Name of the singer or band. singer!="".
        Returns:
        message String. Message that confirm or deny if the song was added.

      • showUsers

        public java.lang.String showUsers()
        Name: showUsers
        This method allow to show all the users.
        Pre: The users array must be created.
        Post: The users array has been shown.
        Returns:
        message String. Message with all the information of all the users.

        Pre: The pool array must be created.
        Post: The pool array has been shown.
        Returns:
        message String. Message with all the information of all the songs.
